partners.name: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology
partners.description: The Ministry of Education (MoE) is responsible for overall development of education in the country.
partners.contact_person: Ministry of Education/Department of Education, Nepal

partners.name: Teach For All
partners.description: Teach For All is a network of 50 independent, locally led and governed partner organizations.

partners.name: Surya Nepal Pvt. Ltd.
partners.description: Surya Nepal Private Limited, a leading Nepalese company, has been a dedicated partner of Teach For Nepal since 2018.

partners.name: Golchha Group
partners.description: The Golchha Group, a pioneering industrial group in Nepal, has been generously supporting Teach For Nepal Movement.

partners.name: Sarvodaya USA
partners.description: Sarvodaya USA is a nonprofit organization dedicated to building a world of communities based on non-violence, service, and cooperation.

partners.name: Nepal Rising
partners.description: Nepal Rising (Daayitwa US) empowers Nepali Americans to drive positive change in Nepal.

partners.name: Everest Bank Limited
partners.description: Everest Bank Limited supports a Teach For Nepal Fellow from Dhanusa district.

partners.name: Siddhartha Bank Ltd.
partners.description: Siddhartha Bank Limited supports a Fellow.

partners.name: Daya Foundation
partners.description: Daya Foundation provides support to Teach For Nepal's core program.

partners.name: Kings College, Nepal
partners.description: Kings College provides scholarships to TFN Fellows to pursue MBA degree.

partners.name: Merojob.com
partners.description: Merojob.com facilitates over 150,000 successful placements and collaborates with Teach For Nepal to connect promising young graduates with impactful opportunities.

partners.name: Vianet Communications
partners.description: Vianet Communications is a leading provider of high-speed Internet connectivity and communications solutions.

staff_members.name: Swastika Shrestha
staff_members.role: Chief Executive Officer, Co-founder and Director of Training and Support
staff_members.bio: Swastika Shrestha has dedicated her career to facilitating life and leadership development among youth in Nepal and the US. After completing her masters in the US, she worked with UNMIN and consulted for IUCN, WFP, and UNDP. Her passion for youth development led her to Teach For Nepal, where she nurtures leaders to transform classrooms, communities, and the nation.

staff_members.name: Krishna Kumar K.C.
staff_members.bio: With over 24 years of teaching experience in primary and secondary schools, Krishna Kumar K.C. has spent 10 years as a Head Teacher in Ashrang, one of the furthest VDCs in Lalitpur. He believes that with the right mindset, teachers can overcome the challenges faced by community schools, including infrastructural problems, policy challenges, and the distance between students’ schools and homes.

staff_members.name: Khika Prasad Nepal
staff_members.bio: Khika Prasad Nepal transitioned from a teaching career to the development field, working at various organizations for over 12 years. He holds a Masters of Sociology from Tribhuvan University. At Teach For Nepal, he works closely with Fellows, Leadership Development Coordinators, and Managers to bring real change to the community.

staff_members.name: Ankush Upreti
staff_members.role: Head of Recruitment Selection and Matriculation (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: Ankush Upreti's transformative experience as a TFN Fellow ignited his passion for youth leadership and educational equity. In his current role, he is dedicated to identifying and nurturing aspiring young leaders who are committed to tackling Nepal's educational crisis.

staff_members.name: Madhav Prasad Devkota
staff_members.role: Head of Training & Community Support (TFN Alumni)
staff_members.bio: As a TFN Fellow, Madhav Prasad Devkota aimed to teach his students beyond academics, including personal hygiene, community sanitation, and balanced diet. In his role as a Training and Community Support Manager, he serves as a role model and source of inspiration for Fellows, helping them face challenges in their Fellowship.

staff_members.name: Ruma Maharjan
staff_members.bio: Ruma Maharjan believes in the power of equity in education to bring about the change Nepal needs. With experience as a recruiter and Events Manager, she is committed to playing a part in the movement for equity at Teach For Nepal.

staff_members.name: Rebati Ram (Rafael) Poudel
staff_members.bio: Rebati Ram Poudel has a deep-rooted commitment to Teach For Nepal, having served in various roles over the years, including School Relations and Placement Coordinator, Director at Youth Initiative, and consultant for the International Labour Organization (ILO). His journey has reinforced his passion for impactful work in Nepal’s development landscape.

staff_members.name: Sadhana Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Sadhana Shrestha returned to Nepal after completing her Master's Degree in Germany, driven by a desire to make a purposeful impact. As a Selection Coordinator at Teach For Nepal, she is dedicated to selecting candidates who are passionate about making a difference in classrooms and communities.

staff_members.name: Preeti Shrestha
staff_members.bio: Preeti Shrestha has been with Teach For Nepal since 2015, driven by her belief in the transformative power of education. In her current role, she embraces the ethos of finding the silver lining in every situation and uncovering the inherent goodness within, while supporting the organization’s mission.

staff_members.name: Shripa Padhan
staff_members.bio: Shripa Padhan has worked with marginalized communities, leading advocacy, capacity-building, and digital storytelling initiatives. Her background in mental health and community-centered work grounds her approach in empathy and intersectionality. She joined Teach For Nepal to amplify the voices of Fellows and support their work.

staff_members.name: Shekhar Kumal
staff_members.bio: Shekhar Kumal has over 10 years of experience in financial management, budgeting, accounting, and compliance within international development programs. He is committed to ensuring smooth and efficient financial management at Teach For Nepal, promoting transparency and accountability.

staff_members.name: Sami Manandhar
staff_members.bio: Sami Manandhar's journey with Teach For Nepal began as a fellow in 2015, motivated by a desire to explore and understand Nepal's diverse communities. Now, as a Project Manager, he aims to contribute to environmental education and empower children to be part of the solution to climate change.

staff_members.name: Jenisha Shakya
staff_members.bio: Jenisha Shakya is a passionate advocate for equitable learning opportunities and inclusive education. With extensive experience in recruitment, leadership, and program management, she rejoined Teach For Nepal to inspire and recruit future leaders who share the vision of transforming education in Nepal.

staff_members.name: Asmita Guragain
staff_members.bio: Asmita Guragain's experience with Teach For Nepal has been a journey of personal growth and societal impact. Inspired by the Fellowship program's impact, she is now a Recruitment Coordinator, advocating for the inclusion of dynamic young leaders in the public education system to ensure equitable education for all.

staff_members.name: Gaurab Ghimire
staff_members.bio: Gaurab Ghimire felt a strong desire to contribute beyond his Fellowship at Teach For Nepal. In his role as a Leadership Development Coordinator, he is passionate about educational equity and committed to supporting Fellows in their roles, helping them thrive and create meaningful impact.

staff_members.name: Samikshya Kharel
staff_members.bio: Samikshya Kharel's journey with Teach For Nepal began as an English Fellow, where she worked closely with students in under-resourced communities. As a Leadership Development Coordinator, she mentors and supports new Fellows, helping them build the skills and confidence needed to create lasting impact.

staff_members.name: Lokesh Khadaka
staff_members.bio: Lokesh Khadaka is a purpose-driven community builder and advocate for quality education and youth leadership. As the Executive Coordinator at Teach For Nepal, he works closely with the CEO to advance the organization’s mission and vision, striving to build a more just and equitable future.

staff_members.name: Hari Krishna Khatri
staff_members.bio: Hari Krishna Khatri's career began with teaching, and he later found his path in the education sector with Teach For Nepal. As a Recruitment Coordinator, he is proud to support and inspire passionate young leaders to join the TFN movement and shape Nepal’s future.

staff_members.name: Akriti Paudel
staff_members.bio: Akriti Paudel's passion for equitable education led her to a two-year fellowship in the Himalayas. This experience fueled her interest in continuing her journey as a Leadership Development Coordinator, dedicated to nurturing and guiding high-potential Fellows to create sustainable change in their classrooms and communities.

staff_members.name: Amir Khokhali
staff_members.bio: Amir Khokhali was inspired by TFN Fellows during his school years and is now working for the organization that shaped his aspirations. With a background in computer application and a passion for education and technology, he aims to contribute to ensuring all children in Nepal receive an excellent education.

staff_members.name: Sirjana Dhital
staff_members.bio: Sirjana Dhital moved to Kathmandu to be closer to her brothers and has been working at Teach For Nepal since its inception. She believes in the importance of education for all children, regardless of their background, and is proud to support the movement that brings young people to teach in rural government schools.
